code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers

td.content: s:patient presents with 5 days history of waking frequently at night, intrusive thoughts, being easily startled or frightened and Mental Health. pt is a white female technical writer aged 57 Ys. Denies ever using tobacco denies any alcohol use o:Height 64 in, Weight 140 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 70, Respiration 14, SSF (suicide status form) (+) High lethality, avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder. Multiple symptoms that are of concern. High risk of lethality. Serious suicidal symptoms. Significant depressed mood. p:administered Zoloft - 50 mg daily, performed SSF (suicide status form), and performed Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation with medical services - Completed. decision was made to admit patient to acute inpatient psychiatric unit

td.content: s:57 YO female presents with 12 days history of trouble sleeping, nightmares and mild agitation. Traumatized approx. 2 years ago when exposed to rape. denies any alcohol use she denies ever using cigarettes o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. BDI 13, CAPS B=1,C=3,D=2. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:patient visited ER. based on that evaluation, patient was admitted for observation and treatment. Proceed with treatment of depressed mood and agitation. performed BDI, CAPS, and performed socialization to treatment - Explained that symptoms were common for someone having experienced such trauma; socialization to treatment - Discussed Safety Plan; counseling about life problems - Discussed other life issues - learned that patient had concern about their drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Suggested various social services available for their drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Discussed with patient their social support network; Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation - Completed, and ordered homework (fill out standard intake forms), homework (read handouts about PTSD therapy).

td.content: s:white female technical writer aged 57 years c/o 10 days h/o mild agitation, trouble sleeping and nightmares. Initial trauma: rape. o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. Review of intake forms done, BDI 13, Suicide assessment mild. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Review of intake forms, BDI, Suicide assessment, and performed socialization to treatment - Discussed homework - helped patient start to fill in goal worksheet; counseling about life problems - Discussed social services to help with their drug abuse; social service referral - Patient agreed they wanted to try NA; socialization to treatment - Discussed Cognitive-behavioral model of PTSD and that such treatments were mostly contraindicated until patient has stabilized and reduced level of anxiety; socialization to treatment - Discussed value of anxiety management exercises; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to list activities that were found to be relaxing; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to choose a previously close confidant to reengage with; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (finish writing goals for therapy), homework (set up appointment with social service), homework (participate in some of the activities identified as relaxing), homework (attempt to contact previously supportive person and talk with them).

td.content: s:Healthy white f technical writer aged 57 Ys. patient complains of mild agitation, trouble sleeping and nightmares and other medical problems stemming from exposure to rape (9/25/2010). o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. Review of patient goals done. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Review of patient goals, and performed socialization to treatment - Reviewed Safety Plan in light of homework; counseling about life problems - Discussed patient interaction with NA; social service referral - Patient agreed to continue working with NA; socialization to treatment - Reviewed relaxation activities since last appointment; socialization to treatment - Reviewed attempt to reengage with former socially supportive person; anxiety management skills - Sleep disruption exercises: discussed sleep hygiene and deep breathing for reengaging with sleep; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills), homework (Continue to participate in activities listed as relaxing), homework (Attempt to have second positive interaction with reengaged support person).

Term.LATERALITY: Effect of exposure to external cause

td.content: s:white f aged 57 yrs c/o 7 weeks h/o frequent vivid nightmares, difficulty participating in activities and intrusive thoughts. Exposed to rape approx. 2 years ago. o:appropriate behavior with no abnormal movement, good eye contact, appears agitated, denies suicidal/homicidal ideation intent or plan, normal speech but slow rate, oriented x 3, poor concentration, affect is appropriate with normal range. Suicide assessment moderate. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Suicide assessment, and performed anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation and progressive muscle relaxation skills practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Socratic dialog used to help patient understand that choices made at time of the traumatic incident were rational at the time; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills).

td.content: s:57 year old f technical writer c/o 12 days h/o mild agitation, trouble sleeping and nightmares. Patient experienced trauma during rape approx. 2 years ago. o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. td.content: s:f technical writer aged 57 Ys reports trouble sleeping, mild agitation. Also complains of nightmares from time to time. Initial trauma: rape occurred 9/25/2010. o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed socialization to treatment - Review Safety Plan; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Teach techniques for overcoming patient overgeneralizations; assessment of treatment progress - Discuss end-of-treatment scenarios; assessment of treatment progress - Patient suggests that there be one more session and then we try holding off on additional sessions; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice new cognitive modification techniques).

td.content: s:57 yr old white female technical writer presents for PTSD evaluation. o:patient responding well to treatment a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed assessment of treatment progress - Agree to not schedule a followup unless/until patient needs one; counseling about life problems - Discuss with patient the importance of continuing to work with NA for addressing issues stemming from their drug abuse; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Review techniques that worked best for patient over course of treatment; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Review various approaches patient can use when crises arise; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed.
